com.oblong.gspeak
Class Pointer

java.lang.Object
  com.oblong.gspeak.Pointer

public class Pointer
extends java.lang.Object

Class representing a single connected device, and its current pointing state: for example, its location, angle, swipe state.

Using the addEventListener(java.lang.Object) method in Pointer, you can subscribe an object to events from a particular Pointer. You can also receive events for all Pointer objects by defining these methods in your sketch.

The Pointer will call the following methods, your sketch or another event listening object that you've set up has methods of the correct name and signature:

    Pointer activity:
  • void pointerAppeared(Pointer p);
  • void pointerVanished(Pointer p);
    Pointer motion:
  • void pointerMoved(Pointer p);
    Pointer intent (soft/hard are normal/double-tap)
  • void pointerSoftened(Pointer p);
  • void pointerHardened(Pointer p);
    Swipe gestures:
  • void pointerSwipedUp(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedDown(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedLeft(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedRight(Pointer p);

Author:
oblong industries, inc.

angleDelta

public float angleDelta(float largestStepDegrees)
Returns the change in angle since the last move. Ignores large changes due to the limited number of events coming from iOS app. (Handles this situation) User applies rotation while pointing -> iOS app sends large angle. User removes finger (no event sent). User starts pointing again -> iOS app sends 0.0f angle.

Parameters:
largestStepDegrees - The largest number of degrees accepted as a valid step
Returns:
difference in device rotation since last move

isSoft

public boolean isSoft()
Input agnostic way to describe if the Pointer is not in an active state: for a mouse, "soft" would be the equivalent of saying no buttons are pressed. With the g-speak Pointer app for iOS, soft means the cursor is moving and the user hasn't double-tapped the screen.

Returns:

removeEventListener

public void removeEventListener(java.lang.Object obj)
Stop sending pointer event messages to a listener.

Parameters:
obj - the listener to whom we stop sending messages

draw

public void draw()
Draw a basic indicator for the phone pointer: a circle around its x, y location. Respects whatever fill / stroke settings are currently in the parent applet, but temporarily sets the sketch's ellipseMode to CENTER.

addEventListener

public void addEventListener(java.lang.Object obj)
Tell this pointer to send pointer events to the provided Object. The pointer will call the following methods of the provided Object when those events occur, provided the Object has methods of the correct name and signature.
    Pointer activity:
  • void pointerAppeared(Pointer p);
  • void pointerVanished(Pointer p);
    Pointer motion:
  • void pointerMoved(Pointer p);
    Pointer intent (soft/hard are normal/double-tap)
  • void pointerSoftened(Pointer p);
  • void pointerHardened(Pointer p);
    Swipe gestures:
  • void pointerSwipedUp(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedDown(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedLeft(Pointer p);
  • void pointerSwipedRight(Pointer p);

Parameters:
obj - an object that has some void pointer*ed(Pointer p) methods

reset

public void reset()
Resets the Pointer to be in the center of the sketch and its angle to 0.
